item.title: All street lights out on Kingsmead road, 19th August
item.description:
From village road to princess Elizabeth way all the street lights are out along Kingsmead road. This was reported before but it's been over 2 weeks that they have been out and now the nights are drawing in it's getting darker earlier. I would like something done asap as nothing is getting done.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Kingsmead Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Footpath becoming impassable due to falling trees and vegetation blocking path., 19th August
item.description:
On footpath leading from Cirencester road (opposite old Witcombe Post Office) and leading into Green Lane in Little Witcombe. The problem was apaprently dealt with in last 12 months but tree has since fallen further leading to a gap only about 1 mtere high. General obstructions also cause by large number of bramble brancehes hanging down over path.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cirencester Road, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large directional signs totally missing, 19th August
item.description:
Large directional signs which are totally missing from the roundabout. Just 2 large posts left leaning in the verge, The signs need to be replaced. Also very badly faded lining on the roundabout. So may near misses from road users not being able to see which lane to be in because the arrows are so faded. This needs to be refreshed asap it is a safety hazard and an accident waiting to happen.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A417, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing bin not being emptied near play area, 19th August
item.description:
Next to play area just after the bridge which goes over Wymans Brook towards Jodami Crescent
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 38, Denman Avenue, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Not mended! Temporary traffic lights have been in place for weeks and your website says it is mended, 19th August
item.description:
This is an ongoing major defect in the road, and I checked on here to see when it was scheduled to be dealt with. I see you appear to have signed it off as complete. There are temporary traffic lights, a 30 mph restriction in both directions (entirely unnecessary northbound once you are past the defect) and a sense of permanence and stagnation around the whole thing. This butts straight onto the hideous collection of barriers which basically obscure the view at the racecourse roundabout. I feel this is now something of an embarrassment for the council and am surprised (am I?) that there seems to be a lack of dynamism to get this sorted out.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Evesham Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No kerbs installed to new roadway incorrectly marked pavement, 19th August
item.description:
The new roadway into Porter close is not finished properly. If you follow white line when driving you would hit kerb .White line to mark kerbs instead of proper kerbs fitted. Instructions on crossing are dangerous and incorrect
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Paygrove Lane, Longlevens, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, Great Western Terrace, Alstone, Cheltenham

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 19th August
item.description:
FMS rcvd 19.08.24 - Overhanging tree very close to house. A tree outside No 2 Robert Burns Avenue which is getting very close to the house with overhanging branches. Estimate it to be within 6-8 feet of the building. There are numerous trees in the road but none of them are anywhere near the adjoining houses. The branches are blocking natural light and this week a squirrel jump from the tree onto the roof of the house, Without being addressed the situation is obviously only going to get worse so could some of these branches trimmed back please.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead branch overhanging both footpath and road junction now beginning to shed portions of timber onto path and traffic, 19th August
item.description:
On grass verge in front of Batsford house on Park Place and Grafton road. On going decay, reported about one year ago.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Park, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Ash Tree located on Highway land

item.title: Grass clippings not cleared from pathway, 19th August
item.description:
This is how the footpath outside my driveway was left after the verge was mown this morning. Please remind operators to take the time to clear footpaths in future so that people do not have to trudge through grass cuttings. There was also a pile of grass cuttings left in the road further down Noverton Avenue which I did not take a photograph of but which also demonstrated the lack of care taken this morning by the operator.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18, Noverton Avenue, Noverton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
